measured_by: Digit Symbol Substitution Task (DSST) / Coding Task
justification: “The coding task (also known as the digit symbol substitution task; DSST)…is aimed to measure functions related to ‘processing speed’ (Wechsler, 2014).”

measured_by: Digit Symbol Substitution Task (DSST) / Coding Task
justification: “…recent work has shown that the coding task does not assess basic psychomotor speed, but instead is sensitive to processes that are more associated with executive functioning (Knowles et al., 2015).”

“A handful of studies have investigated the role of the opioid system in impulsive behavior, typically assessing delay discounting. In a delay discounting task, subjects make choices between options that either result in smaller immediate rewards or larger delayed rewards.”
“Petrovic and colleagues (2008) used opioid blockade … during a gambling task with rewards and losses in 15 healthy men to assess the role of endogenous opioids.”
“Using a Pavlovian instrumental transfer (PIT) task with chocolate reinforcement, Weber and colleagues (2016) found a significant reduction … following 50 mg naltrexone.”

“The effects of blocking opioid receptors on response inhibition as assessed by the Stroop task has been investigated … Both studies revealed that overall Stroop performance was not affected by the pharmacological manipulation.”

“The modulation of the startle reflex to a noise burst following a prestimulus, a phenomenon called prepulse inhibition, has been shown to be enhanced by a low dose of 10 mg PO morphine (Quednow et al., 2008).”
“An old study by Primac and colleagues (1957) did not find an effect … on the Wisconsin Card Sorting Test,” which the authors list under tasks focused on planning and flexible switching of behaviour.
“A recent study showed that a low dose of infused remifentanil … impaired attention in a letter detection task when participants expected that the drug would be administered (Atlas et al., 2014).”
